Invalid JSON input for tool create_issue: {"owner": "mcpmark-eval", "repo": "harmony", "title": "Upgrade JavaScript demo to use ESM imports and modern module system", "body": "## Problem
The current JavaScript demo uses CommonJS require statements which are outdated and limit compatibility with modern tools and environments. This approach also creates issues with module bundling and tree-shaking optimizations.

## Proposed Solution
Migrate the JavaScript demo from CommonJS to ESM imports to leverage the modern JavaScript module system. This would involve updating package.json and refactoring import statements throughout the demo code.

## Benefits
- Better compatibility with modern build tools
- Improved module bundling through tree-shaking
- Alignment with current JavaScript standards
- Enhanced developer experience

This enhancement addresses issue #26 and aims to modernize our JavaScript demo.

Keywords: CommonJS, ESM imports, module bundling, modern JavaScript", "labels": enhancement}
